This article may require cleanup to meet Wikipedia's quality standards. No cleanup reason has been specified. Please help improve this article if you can. (June 2011) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania.
Great Barrier Reef, Australia is one of the most visited places of diving tourists.
The Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, Turkey.
Machu Picchu in Cusco, Peru, one of the most visited destinations in South America.
Ciutat de les Arts i les Ciències in Valencia, Spain.


Adjectival tourism is the numerous niche or specialty travel forms of tourism; each with its own adjective.

Examples of the more common niche tourism markets include:


Adventure and extreme[edit]

  • Adventure tourism
  • Extreme tourism
  • Space tourism

Culture and the arts[edit]

  • Bookstore tourism
  • Cultural tourism
  • Heritage tourism
  • Literary tourism
  • Music tourism
  • Pop-culture tourism
  • Tolkien tourism

Extralegal[edit]

  • Drug tourism
  • Female sex tourism
  • Sex tourism
  • Suicide tourism

Food and drink[edit]

  • Culinary tourism
  • Wine tourism

Historical[edit]

  • Archaeological tourism
  • Atomic tourism
  • Genealogy tourism
  • Militarism heritage tourism

Low-impact[edit]

  • CouchSurfing
  • Ecotourism
  • Geotourism
  • Sustainable tourism

Medical and dental[edit]

  • Dental tourism
  • Fertility tourism
  • Medical tourism
  • Wellness tourism

Miscellaneous[edit]

  • Accessible tourism
  • Garden tourism
  • Libel tourism
  • Sports tourism

Nature and rural[edit]

  • Agritourism
  • Jungle tourism
  • Rural tourism
  • Village tourism
  • Wildlife tourism

Nightlife and party[edit]

  • Stag party tourism

Religious[edit]

  • Christian tourism
  • Halal tourism
  • Kosher tourism
  • Religious tourism

Science and Education[edit]

  • Astronomy tourism

Voyeuristic[edit]

  • Dark tourism
  • Disaster tourism
  • Ghetto tourism
  • Jihadi tourism
  • Poverty tourism
  • Township tourism
  • War tourism

Water-related[edit]

  • Nautical tourism
  • Shark tourism
  • Water tourism

References[edit]
